candidates.title: fix: warnings on native and web
candidates.body: Fixes: #994

candidates.title: Fix input lag
candidates.body:
Fixes #865 

This was due to a thundering herd of cancelled timers whose spawned tasks weren't woken when aborted and instead remained suspended until woken by our reactor, causing thousands of async tasks to pile up in suspension, only to wake up after their 80s timeout to realize they were aborted

candidates.title: Clean up deploy output
candidates.body: Just show the url that the user can click

candidates.title: Tangent 0.2
candidates.body:
Tangent 0.2!

Now with a third-person character who can get in and out of spawned vehicles, plus some new mods:

- two choices of HUD
- character classes
- firerain environmental mod

Also, in the process of doing this, I discovered that the vehicles are approximately a third of the size they should be. Had to spend an hour rebalancing all of the stats...

Plus some minor fixes:
- `use_entity_{component,concept}` now get fired when the entity despawns
- `mod_manager` now includes local packages too

candidates.title: Style mod manager
candidates.body: This only styles the mod manager (left the other windows for lack of time).

candidates.title: Add debugger and performance tooling for the web client
candidates.body:
Adds a stats section to the debugger, and makes the debugger configurable on the web client

![image](https://github.com/AmbientRun/Ambient/assets/25723553/3d428b78-9735-4c18-8c4b-c017db7f15f1)

Fixes: #650 

Unifies the call to init and start, as there is really no reason to separate them, which makes it easier to pass settings around. This requires not calling the now defunct `init` function on the website, but I've opened a PR for that there as well.

candidates.title: Fix pbr rendering
candidates.body:
This PR fixes a few things
- The white default material is no longer an off gray
- This extends to adding color
- Fix incorrect multiplied and defaulted metallic and roughness values for imported models, this fixes odd gleams for unity trees and models where they should be rough leaves
- Fix invisible vantablack models
- Expand the PR example

candidates.title: feat(macro): make concepts partialeq
candidates.body: Pretty straightforward, just running it through the CI "just in case"

candidates.title: bump as-any; get rid of downcast-rs usage
candidates.body:
NOTE: as the new `as-any` version implements `Downcast` directly for everything that could support it, name resolution changes a bit and requires more explicit dereferences.

* `cargo fmt --check` passes
* `cargo test --all` passes

candidates.title: Tangent improvements
candidates.body: Merging in what I've done so far to bring across nameplates + make the new level generally accessible.

candidates.title: Fix sky on the web
candidates.body:
Fixes:
  - Tint and Wgpu/Naga disagreement of `textureSampleLevel` signature
  - Incorrect mie scattering, leading to a fuzzy/hazy sky
  - Unaccounted sun color for atmosphere, this is configurable by users, and should as such be reflected
  - Atmosphere remains if sun is dimmed
  - Add atmospheric absorption, the air isn't perfectly transparent
  - Fix circular cutoff in the void
  - Soften the small white disk that is the sun (or rather a plate in the sky)

candidates.title: Misc fixes
candidates.body:
Have been working on Tangent in the background, but pulled these fixes/changes out from my branch as they're generally relevant.

- You can now set `general.user_id` for the native client's settings.
- `Text3D` lets you easily position text in space. I'm not sure about its interface quite yet, but it does make it much easier.
- `LayoutFreeCenter` offers a solution to the problem of centering 3D text (#112). It's not the best solution - ideally the mesh itself would be centered at the point - but it works.
- Literally no use of `use_entity_component` uses the setter. I've removed it to make it simpler and to make it clearer that you can't manipulate the server with it.
- The desktop and web clients now generate a nice AdjectiveAnimal name if you don't have one specified. After this goes in, I'll probably pass the user_id in as an argument for the web client so that your profile username becomes your ingame username.

candidates.title: Fix Windows + Chrome rendering due to invalid mesh ids
Randomly generated IDs
candidates.body:
Closes #679, closes #921.

The code for the CLI was rearranged because my initial plan was to move all of the package commands into a `package` subcommand, and then set up top-level aliases, but I ran into a few hurdles and decided to leave it as-is for now.

I won't automerge this until I have signoff from the reviewers because I suspect we'll want to wipe the database before we do.

candidates.title: feat(campfire): replace OpenSSL with Rust deps
candidates.body: Really didn't want to go through the hassle of getting OpenSSL to work on Windows, so I just replaced the logic with Rust equivalents. My Chrome starts up and connects to my 127.0.0.1 server OK. Need to test on the other platforms.

candidates.title: Remote shutdown and teardown of render loop
Tangent 0.1
candidates.body:
The all-new and improved Tangent, brought to you by my weekend.

Features:
- Packages for Kenney's Digital Audio, Impact Sounds, Space Kit
- Basic explosions
- A top-down camera and a follow camera
- A class system with three distinct classes (Assault, Scout, Tank)
- A procedural level
- A class selection UI
- An improved "holographic HUD"
- Health pickups
- An aimable laser gun

Oh, and almost all of these are implemented as mods, so you can change them out at runtime.

Also features the following Ambient changes:
- Macro now generates `assets` module at package level, not at scope level
- Added a `fixed_rate_tick` method to make it easy to do an action every so often (used for input)
- A bunch of semantic fixes
- A bunch of preliminary work to make `Entity` a valid component value type; I tried going further, but WIT does not allow for recursive type definitions, so I had to give up. My plan was to use a serialized representation instead, but we have a lot of macro-driven code that makes special-casing things difficult, and fixing that would take too much time.
- Exposed `remove_at_game_time` to the guest
- Added `camera::get_active` as a helper method
- Added a global `lerp` function
- Fixed a few crashes
- Added `--window-{x,y,width,height}` launch parameters to make it easy to launch two clients side-by-side
- Improved `ambient new`:
  - The start of #679 - new packages now have a 32-char ID generated. Still need to add the checksum. 
  - `--name` no longer appends to the path, making it usable as a configuration parameter
  - `--in-workspace` can be passed in to avoid generating unnecessary files if you're already in a workspace (no Cargo config, no VSCode settings, etc)
  - `--rust {none, empty, quad}` (defaults to quad) can now be used to choose the template used. None generates no Rust code (ideal for schemas), Empty generates empty main functions, while Quad generates the standard quad example we have so far. I foresee this being revamped in the short-to-mid-term future with different examples for different types of games.
  - Altogether, this means you can make a mod for Tangent using `ambient new guest/rust/packages/games/tangent/mods/my_cool_mod --name "Tangent Mod: My Cool Mod!" --in-workspace --rust empty` and then replacing a few lines in the manifest to make it fully compatible. You don't have to delete files or lines of code any more.

candidates.title: feat: add url helpers
candidates.body:
Adds URL helpers to reduce duplication and to help with moving the URLs when required.

Also fixes:
- web URL in deployment
- using the proper API request for package manager

candidates.title: Fix windows rendering
candidates.body: Fixes: #651

candidates.title: Mod manager
candidates.body:
Revises the package manager to act double-duty as a mod manager by specifying the `mod_manager_for` component on its package entity.

There are a few TODOs, but it works without fixing them:

- Filter what's relevant to us using the API, not by grabbing all of it and filtering there
- Add `content` and `playable_for` to the package components so we can figure out if a local package is relevant without having to ask the server about it

Notably, this does not make any changes to Ambient (outside of making Campfire deploy mods) - this should mean it's compatible with today's nightly.

candidates.title: Disable watch by default and add `--watch` to `campfire web serve`
Fix excessive rebuilds
candidates.body:
https://github.com/AmbientRun/Ambient/issues/835

This works almost like the git-version macro, the main difference being: it keeps only the `.git/logs/HEAD` as a dependency for rebuilds while git-version also tracks `.git/index`.

candidates.title: Derived `children` from `parent`
candidates.body: This fixes client-server synchronization of hierarchies; instead of synchronizing the `children` we now only synchronize `parent` and instead construct `children` based on parents. (Re. #843 )

candidates.title: Update locked deps to make them match
candidates.body: ... to fix CI

candidates.title: Global focus
candidates.body:
Resolves #620, Resolves #804, Resolves #789

There are actually two focuses still with this PR; one for the main app, and one for the game world. The one for the game world is shared between all packages though. This also gets rid of the cursor guard; instead it's handled by the hide_cursor package which essentially hides and locks the cursor when nothing is focused.

candidates.title: Pull out character animations from afps
Refactor animations
candidates.body: Getting rid of the `ref_count`, so that we can do #773 , but in doing so we also needed to solve lifetime of animations nodes. One way of handling that is by using the Elements infra, which normally is used for UI, but which can be used to produce any arbitrary entity tree. Not sure yet if this is the final solution, but seems to work ok.

candidates.title: remove audio in first person camera
candidates.body:
Should fix https://github.com/AmbientRun/Ambient/issues/770

Don't think we should remove the spatial audio from physics:

- It does not add much complexity
- It's a good fit for the example (there was once a TODO of adding sound and I agreed with that)

Non-spatial audio is shown in the `audio_ctrl` example.
